listening.name: Listening
listening.instruction: Listen to the word and tap the matching word

typing.name: Typing
typing.typeKeyboardOrTap: Type on your keyboard or tap the box above to type

firstSound.name: First Sounds
firstSound.instruction: Which word starts with the same sound?

synonyms.name: Synonyms & Antonyms
synonyms.synonymInstruction: Which word means the same as:
synonyms.antonymInstruction: Which word means the opposite of:

scramble.name: Sentence Scramble
scramble.instruction: Put these words in the correct order
scramble.tapToSwap: Tap two words to swap them

clockMatching.name: Clock Matching
clockMatching.instruction: Match the digital time with the analog clock

timeOrdering.name: Time Ordering
timeOrdering.instruction: Put these activities in the correct time order
timeOrdering.tapToSwap: Tap two buttons to swap them

workingMemory.name: Working Memory
workingMemory.instruction: Watch the sequence, then select the items in the same order
workingMemory.sequenceFull: Sequence is full - clear to change
workingMemory.perfectMemory: Perfect! You remembered the sequence correctly
workingMemory.tryAgain: Try again! Clear your selection and try once more

progress.title: Your Progress
progress.subtitle: See the progress you are making
progress.startPracticingMessage: Start practicing to see your progress here!
progress.takeAssessmentMessage: Take an assessment to track your progress objectively!
progress.practiceMoreRecommendations: Practice more to get personalized recommendations.
progress.noTestsYet: No tests taken yet for this exercise.
progress.cannotRetake: Cannot retake this test - word list not saved.

info.qualityScore: Quality Score combines consistency (practice frequency), duration (session length), variety (different exercises), and accuracy into a single metric.
info.accuracyTrend: Shows your daily accuracy percentage over time. The dotted line is a 7-day moving average to show overall trends.
info.accuracyCalculation: Accuracy for a given day is calculated as: (Correct Attempts / Total Attempts) Ã— 100%. Only days with practice activity are shown.
info.heatmap: Darker colors indicate better performance. Each cell shows accuracy for a specific exercise on a specific day.
info.assessmentComparison: Compares your performance between standardized assessments to measure objective progress.

recommendations.title: Focus Areas
recommendations.consistency: Try to practice more consistently - aim for 5 days per week
recommendations.duration: Increase session length - aim for 15-20 minutes per session
recommendations.variety: Try more exercise types - variety helps overall improvement
recommendations.goodJob: Great job! Keep up the consistent practice.

assessment.title: Progress Assessment
assessment.subtitle: Standardized test to measure your progress
assessment.levelUpMessage: Congratulations! You've mastered all exercises. Ready to try {level}?

baseline.name: Full Baseline
baseline.description: Comprehensive test across all exercise types. Master all 12 exercise types at easy level to unlock harder difficulty levels.

quick.name: Quick Check
quick.description: Short assessment of individual exercise types at your current level

assessment.needsAssessment: You need at least 2 assessments to compare.
assessment.takeFirstAssessment: Take an assessment to track progress.
assessment.pauseConfirm: Pause assessment? You can resume later.
assessment.testModeDescription: Structured assessment to evaluate your skills
assessment.instruction1: Select an exercise type and difficulty level
assessment.instruction2: Choose the number of questions (5, 10, 15, or 20)
assessment.instruction3: Questions are randomized from the selected difficulty
assessment.instruction4: Your hints, skips, and time are tracked
assessment.instruction5: Results help recommend appropriate difficulty levels
assessment.question: Question

settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Personalize the interface and exercises

options.voiceTestPhrase: Hello! This is how the voice sounds.
options.customFrequencyDesc: How often to use your custom exercises
options.problemFrequencyDesc: How often to show difficult words
options.masteryStreakDesc: Correct answers in a row to master a word
options.exportTranslationDesc: Download all text as CSV for translation
options.importTranslationDesc: Upload translated CSV to add new language
options.createBackupDesc: Download all your data and settings
options.resetProgressDesc: This will delete all progress but keep custom exercises
options.resetEverythingDesc: Delete ALL data including custom exercises

settings.practiceDifficultyDesc: Set the difficulty level for each exercise type in practice mode

bulkUpload.title: Bulk Upload from CSV
bulkUpload.selectExercises: Select exercise types to include in template
bulkUpload.step1: Select which exercise types you want to upload and download the template
bulkUpload.step2: Open it in Excel, Google Sheets, or any spreadsheet app
bulkUpload.step3: Fill in your custom exercises following the format
bulkUpload.headerNote: âš ï¸ IMPORTANT: First row must be: exercise_type,difficulty,data1,data2,data3,data4,data5
bulkUpload.difficultyNote: Difficulty is ALWAYS in column 2 (easy, medium, or hard)
bulkUpload.pictureFormatCode: exercise_type, difficulty, word, emoji_or_image_url, option1, option2, option3
bulkUpload.pictureExample: Example: picture/typing/listening, easy, apple, ðŸŽ, banana, orange, pear
bulkUpload.pictureUrlExample: Or: apple, https://example.com/apple.jpg, banana, orange, pear, easy
bulkUpload.pictureNote: Note: This creates exercises for all three types. Options are ignored for typing.
bulkUpload.categoryFormatCode: exercise_type, difficulty, category, correct_word, wrong1, wrong2, wrong3
bulkUpload.categoryExample: Example: category, easy, fruit, apple, carrot, bread, chair
bulkUpload.sentenceExample: Example: sentenceTyping, easy, I drink ? every morning, coffee (use ? or __ for blank)
bulkUpload.speakingFormatCode: exercise_type, difficulty, word, emoji, phrase1, phrase2
bulkUpload.speakingExample: Example: speaking, easy, apple, ðŸŽ, An apple a day..., I eat an apple
bulkUpload.firstSoundExample: Example: firstSound, easy, b, ball, car|house|table
bulkUpload.rhymingExample: Example: rhyming, easy, cat, hat, dog|cup|tree
bulkUpload.definitionsExample: Example: definitions, easy, chair, A piece of furniture for sitting, table|car|tree
bulkUpload.associationExample: Example: association, easy, bread, butter, car|phone|tree
bulkUpload.synonymsFormatCode: exercise_type, difficulty, word, is_synonym(true/false), correct_word, wrong_words
bulkUpload.synonymsExample: Examples: synonyms, easy, happy, true, glad, sad|angry|tired
bulkUpload.synonymsExample2: synonyms, easy, hot, false, cold, warm|tepid|cool
bulkUpload.scrambleExample: Example: scramble, easy, The cat is sleeping
bulkUpload.timeSequencingFormatCode: exercise_type, difficulty, question, answer, wrong_options (separated by |)
bulkUpload.timeSequencingExample: Example: timeSequencing, easy, What day comes after Monday?, Tuesday, Wednesday|Sunday|Friday
bulkUpload.clockMatchingFormatCode: exercise_type, difficulty, time, time_words, wrong_times (separated by |)
bulkUpload.timeOrderingFormatCode: exercise_type, difficulty, scenario, activity1, activity2, activity3, ...
bulkUpload.timeOrderingExample: Example: timeOrdering, easy, Morning routine, Wake up, Brush teeth, Eat breakfast, Go to work
bulkUpload.timeOrderingNote: Note: Add as many activities as needed in correct order
bulkUpload.workingMemoryFormatCode: exercise_type, difficulty, sequence (3 emojis), extra_options (3+ emojis)

forms.uploadPictureHelp: Upload a picture for this word
forms.autoGenerateHelp: Leave empty to auto-generate from other words
forms.question: Question
forms.timeQuestionPlaceholder: e.g., What day comes after Monday?
forms.timeOptionsHelp: Enter 3 wrong answer choices separated by commas
forms.descriptionPlaceholder: e.g., Put these daily activities in order
forms.activitiesPlaceholder:
Wake up
Eat breakfast
Go to work
Eat dinner
Go to sleep
forms.activitiesHelp: Enter activities in the correct order, one per line
forms.timeWordsHelp: How the time should be spoken
forms.sequenceHelp: Enter exactly 3 emojis that will be shown in sequence
forms.extraOptionsHelp: Enter at least 3 additional emojis as wrong choices

wordbank.definitionPlaceholder: A short description of the word
wordbank.distractorsPlaceholder: banana, orange, grape, cherry, mango, peach, plum, kiwi, pear, melon
wordbank.distractorsHelp: Min 3, ideally 10 words of similar length. Used as wrong options. Must NOT be synonyms, antonyms, rhymes, or associated words.
wordbank.distractorsRequired: Please enter at least 3 distractor words.
wordbank.rhymesPlaceholder: e.g., cat â†’ hat, bat, mat
wordbank.associatedPlaceholder: e.g., bread â†’ butter, toast, jam
wordbank.sentencesPlaceholder:
I eat an apple.
The apple is red.
wordbank.sentencesHelp: One per line. Use for sentence completion (word will be blanked).
wordbank.phrasesPlaceholder: An apple a day keeps the doctor away
wordbank.indicatorHelp: Highlighted = this word will appear in that exercise
wordbank.noExercisesCreated: No exercises could be created. Please add an image/emoji for picture exercises or other required data.

session.pausedMessage: You've been away for a while. Ready to continue?
